title: Clinic, physicians challenge revised North Dakota abortion laws in ongoing lawsuit
description: An ongoing lawsuit calls North Dakota's abortion restrictions unconstitutional.

title: New York City police commissioner, first woman to lead department, resigns after 18 months
description: New York City Police Commissioner Keechant Sewell is stepping down after 18 months on the job

title: FTC sues to block Microsoft's takeover of video game maker Activision Blizzard
description: The Federal Trade Commission has sued to block Microsoft from completing its deal to buy video game company Activision Blizzard, the latest antitrust challenge to the proposed merger but one that could hasten its conclusion

title: Students wounded in Michigan State shooting take steps toward lawsuit
description: Two students who were among eight killed or wounded in a winter shooting at Michigan State University are taking steps toward suing the school

title: 'First of its kind' Illinois law will penalize libraries that ban books
description: Libraries pledge not to ban material because of partisan disapproval.

title: GOP candidate knocks Biden, weighs in on Trump indictment but won't say his name
description: Presidential candidate Doug Burgum appeared on "GMA3" on Monday where he criticized the Biden administration and briefly addressed Trump's second indictment

title: Al Sharpton blames systemic flaws at funeral of Florida mother killed by neighbor
description: Ajike Owens was killed by a white woman who allegedly used racial slurs against children.

title: Washington Post publisher Fred Ryan leaves paper after 9 years at helm
description: Washington Post publisher and chief executive Fred Ryan is leaving the newspaper after nine years in charge

title: Boat capsizes during underground cave tour in upstate New York
description: A tour boat capsized Monday morning at the Lockport Cave, a historical, underground boat ride along the Erie Canal in upstate New York, authorities said.

title: Asteroid the size of a bridge expected to pass by Earth, NASA says
description: NASA says an asteroid that spans 1,500 feet -- the size of a bridge -- is expected to pass by Earth Monday.

title: Toddler dies after shooting unsecured firearm: Police
description: A 2-year-old child in Michigan died from an accidental shooting Sunday evening after accessing an unsecured firearm.

title: Senator asks LIV Golf, PGA Tour leaders for records on merger
description: The leader of a Senate subcommittee wants the PGA Tour and Saudi Arabia’s LIV Golf to present records about negotiations that led to their new agreement and plans for what golf will look like under the arrangement

title: Elizabeth Gilbert delays novel set in Russia, citing objections from Ukrainians
description: Author Elizabeth Gilbert is delaying publication of a novel she had set in Russia after she said she received an outpouring of “anger, sorrow, disappointment and pain” from Ukrainian readers who objected to releasing any work about Russia amid that cou...

title: New York City protects access to gender-affirming care
description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams has signed an executive order to protect access to gender-affirming care.

title: Biden to undergo completion of root canal, miss 'College Athlete Day' celebration
description: Dr. Kevin O'Connor said the procedure will be done at the White House.

title: Supreme Court won't review state decision to nix license plates with Confederate flag
description: The Supreme Court says it won’t review North Carolina’s decision to stop issuing specialty license plates with the Confederate flag

title: JPMorgan reaches settlement with victims of Jeffrey Epstein
description: Terms of the settlement were not disclosed.

title: Woman in custody in Austria after reportedly torturing son, 12
description: A woman is in custody in Austria after reportedly abusing her 12-year-old son by shutting him in a dog box, pouring cold water over him and leaving him exposed to freezing temperatures

title: Demolition underway at site of deadly Iowa apartment building collapse
description: Demolition began Monday at the site of the Davenport, Iowa, apartment building that partially collapsed last month, claiming three lives.

title: Watchdog: Nuclear states modernize their weapons, Chinese arsenal is growing
description: A report on the world's nuclear weapons says the nine nuclear-armed states continue to modernize their arsenals and several of them deployed new nuclear-armed or nuclear-capable weapons systems in 2022

title: US decides to rejoin UNESCO and pay back dues, to counter Chinese influence
description: U.N. cultural and scientific agency UNESCO has announced that the United States plans to rejoin — and pay more than $600 million in back dues — after a decade-long dispute sparked by the organization’s move to include Palestine as a member

title: Greece: 90 migrants rescued from US-flagged yacht in distress
description: Greek authorities say 90 migrants including 37 children have been rescued from a U.S.-flagged yacht believed to be bound for Italy

title: British man detained after climbing to 72nd floor of Seoul skyscraper
description: He used his bare hands to climb up the fifth-tallest skyscraper, officials said.

title: Scott rolls out dozens of lawmakers and local leaders endorsing his presidential bid
description: Sen. Tim Scott is rolling out endorsements from more than 140 current and former elected officials from his home state of South Carolina

title: Driver charged after bus transporting wedding guests rolls over, killing 10
description: At least 10 people were killed and 25 others were injured after a bus carrying wedding guests rolled over in Australia's wine country late Sunday, authorities said.

title: WATCH:  Woman makes half-court shot to win free beer
description: A woman made a half-court shot to win free beer for a year, to the delight of the crowd at a basketball game.

title: 'Innocent of any wrongdoing,' former Scottish leader says after police questioning
description: Former Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon said after facing police questioning in police custody on Sunday that she was "innocent of any wrongdoing."

title: UN cultural agency UNESCO announces US plans to rejoin
description: UN cultural agency UNESCO announces US plans to rejoin, including paying off arrears of $600 million

title: Former Italian Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi dead at 86, Italian media reports
description: Silvio Berlusconi, the three-time Italian premier and former leader of the Forza Italia party had suffered with a series of medical ailments over the past several years.

title: Biden to host outgoing NATO secretary-general Stoltenberg
description: President Joe Biden is welcoming outgoing NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg to the White House on Monday as the competition to find his successor to lead the military alliance heats up

title: Police: 3 dead, 3 wounded in shooting at Maryland home stemming from dispute
description: Three people were killed and three wounded in a shooting Sunday night at a house in the Maryland’s capital city, the police chief said

title: Philippines' Mayon Volcano spews lava, putting thousands on alert
description: The Philippines’ most active volcano is gently spewing lava down its slopes, alerting tens of thousands of people they may have to quickly flee a violent and life-threatening explosion

title: Australia police: initial inquiries indicate 10 dead in overnight bus crash
description: Police say a bus carrying wedding guests rolled over on a foggy night in Australia’s wine country, killing 10 people and injuring 25

title: China struggles with weak post-COVID economic recovery
description: China's manufacturing and consumer spending are weakening after a strong start to 2023 after anti-virus controls ended

title: Alex Newell, J. Harrison Ghee become 1st nonbinary actors to win a Tony Awards
description: The 76th Annual Tony Awards were held at the United Palace Theater on Sunday night.

title: Severe storm threat to over 40 million Americans
description: More than 40 million Americans are on alert for possible severe storms that may bring isolated tornadoes.

title: Trump plans to head to Florida Monday as search for expanded legal team continues
description: Donald Trump is expected to head to Florida midday Monday ahead of his first appearance Tuesday before a federal judge, sources familiar with the planning told ABC News.
